abstract.para: This role automates the installation, configuration, and management of the Advanced Intrusion Detection Environment (AIDE) on remote servers using Ansible. It streamlines the process of setting up a critical security tool, ensuring consistency across your infrastructure.

topic.para: With this role, you can automate a complex and vital security task, ensuring your servers are continuously monitored for unauthorized file changes with minimal manual effort.

section.title: &aide; role variables
section.para: These variables are a set of customizable parameters used to control the behavior of the AIDE setup.

row.entry: Specifies the path to the Jinja2 template for the aide.conf file.
Defines the directory on the control node where the AIDE database will be securely stored after being retrieved from the managed host.
Fetches the database from the remote nodes to store it on the control node.
Runs an integrity check on the remote nodes.
Updates the AIDE database and stores it on the controller node.
If set to true, configures periodic cron check for &aide;. If set to false, removes the periodic cron check.

example.title: An &aide; playbook example
example.para: This playbook installs and configures AIDE and then initializes its database on a target server. It also fetches the new database and store it securely on your local machine.
example.screen:
- name: Deploy and initialize AIDE hosts: your_servers become: true vars: # Path to your custom AIDE configuration file template aide_conf_template: files/my_custom_aide.conf.j2
# Path where AIDE will store its database on the remote server aide_db_path: /var/lib/aide/aide.db.gz
# Path on your Ansible control node to store the secure backup aide_db_remote_path: "{{ playbook_dir }}/aide_backups/{{ inventory_hostname }}.db.gz"
tasks: - name: Run the AIDE role to set up the system and create a baseline database ansible.builtin.include_role: name: aide_role vars: aide_action: init # This variable tells the role to initialize the database
- name: Securely fetch the initial AIDE database ansible.builtin.fetch: src: "{{ aide_db_path }}" dest: "{{ aide_db_remote_path }}" flat: true

listitem.para: name: A descriptive name for the playbook.
hosts: Specifies the target hosts from your Ansible inventory. In this case, all means it runs on every host.
become: This is equivalent to using &sudo;. It grants the playbook &rootuser; privileges to install packages and manage services.
roles: This is where you call the ssh_roleyou created.
